level.heading: Organization.
level.text: There is hereby established in the DMV offices and divisions as follows:
The Office of the Director, with subordinate staff offices as are required to carry out overall management responsibility for the office;
Division of Adjudication, with subordinate staff offices as required, to coordinate and manage the functions as follows:
Customer Services Division, with such subordinate staff offices as are required, to coordinate and manage the following functions for the District:
Driver testing, including medical reviews and insurance compliance; and

Support Services Division, with such subordinate staff offices as are required to coordinate and manage the procurement, financial, technology and administrative functions for the Department of Motor Vehicles, and management of the personal property inventory for the Department of Motor Vehicles.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 13-91 validated a previously made technical amendment in subsec. (2).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary addition of chapter, see note to § 50-901.
For temporary (90-day) addition of Chapter 1A, see notes following § 50-901.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 12-175
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 12-175, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 50-901.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 13-91
level.text: Law 13-91, the "Technical Amendments Act of 1999," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-435, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 2, 1999, and December 7, 1999, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 29, 1999, it was assigned Act No. 13-234 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-91 became effective on April 12, 2000.
